page.title: 09Transport Services
page.content: As there is not a bridge linking either Truro or Falmouth with the area journeys to these towns are long and the roads are very winding.The nearest rail terminals are at Truro and St.Austell,making travel from these stations to the area,a very complicated and expensive operation,as bus services are so infrequent and taxi services extremely costly. {St.Mawes to Falmouth Ferry. There are two different types of ferry operating on the Roseland Peninsula that are used by local people.One of these which links the Roseland Peninsula with Truro is some six miles from the block.The other ferry sails from St.Mawes Quay to the Prince of Wales pier and carries only passengers and cycles.This ferry takes about half an hour and operates every half hour in the summer and every hour in Winter
